revised_title: On the Absorption of Polarized Light by Doubly Refracting Crystals
tldr: The author, David Brewster, investigates the absorption of polarized light by doubly refracting crystals and discovers that certain crystals can absorb different colors of light depending on their position and orientation. This phenomenon is related to the axes of double refraction and can be observed in various crystals, such as calcareous spar and topaz.
